docs.lead_paragraph: ITALIAN OPERA.--Signorina VESTVALI commenced a short season of Italian Opera at Burton's Theatre last night, under favorable auspices, and was received with great applause by her numerous admirers and old friends. The opera selected for the occasion was "Lucretia Borgia," and the cast embraced the names of VESTVALI, LOUISA CARANTI BRIGNOLI, AMODIO and COLLETI.

headline.main: Terrible Disaster on Long Island Sound.; HAD THE PROPELLER A LIGHT?? Sudden Death on Board the Steamer. INTERESTING FACTS CONCERNING THE LOST. Contradictory Evidence on Important Points. NAMES OF THE LOST AND SAVED. Propeller J. N. Harris run down by the Steamer Metropolis, and Sunk. Statements of Capt. Smith, of the Propeller, Capt. Brown, of the Metropolis, and of Many Others. THIRTEEN LIVES LOST.

docs.lead_paragraph: There was collision on Long Island Sound last Saturday morning, which had an exceedingly unfortunate result. The Sound steamer Metropolis, Capt. Brown, that left Fall River Friday evening at 7 1/4 o'clock, wren between Falkland Island and New have at 2 o'clock Saturday morning, came in contact with the propeller J. N HARRIS, Capt. SMITH, on her way from New-York to New London.

docs.lead_paragraph: Brroklyn Board of Health. FRIDAY, Aug. 14, 1857. The Board met at 5 o'clock P. M. Present: Mayor POWELL, (presiding,) and Aldermen SCHOLS, VAN BRUNT and FIT?IAN. The minutes were read and approved. The nuisance at the corner of Columbia-steest and Hamilton avenue, complained of by WM. FERGUSON, was referred to the Alderman of the Ward to abate.

headline.main: Death of Judge Lee at Honolala.

docs.lead_paragraph: Hon. WILLIAM L. LEE died at his residence in Honolulu on Thursday, 28th inst. The name of the ?? Chief J stice is so ?? connected with the history of these islands for the last ten or twelve years that it would prove a difficult task to point to ?? important measure of the Government, of any worthy social effort in which he did not take a part.

docs.lead_paragraph: A serious and fatal collision occurred on Long Island Sound, about 2 o'clock on Saturday morning last, between the steamer Metropolis. Captain BROWN, of the Fall River line of Steamers, which was coming up the Sound, and the propeller J. N. Harris, Capt. LEONARD SMITH, bound from New-York to New-London. The later had a crew of eleven persons, all told, and fourteen passengers,

The London Times has been devoting its skill to an analysis of the character of Bishops, Young Bishops, it says start with the idea, prevalent in nurseries and around ladies workstands, that Bishops can "do" things; that they can manage to reform abuses, set thing right, make the clergy do their duty, and so forth.

docs.lead_paragraph: RICORS OF THE SEASON.-The heat yesterday was excessive; though the thermometer ran up under its influence, everything else ran down, particularly fancy stocks in Wall-street, It was altogether the hottest day we have experienced during the Summer, and a few more like it will nearly deplete the City, while the hotels at the watering places will be crowded.

headline.main: Fight With the Indians--General Rusk--Southern Items.

docs.lead_paragraph: New-Orleans papers of the 8th inst. are to hand. Lieut. Hood, of the Second Cavalry, with seventeen men, had a desperate encounter with a band of forty-five Lipans and Camanches, of the 20th of July, at the head of Devil River. The fight was a hand-to-hand one. Nine Indians were killed and ten wounded. Lieut. Hood had one killed and one missing, and he
